info.title: CHIPS Bill Payments API
info.description:
The CHIPS Bill Payments API utilizes the CHIPS® Payment Network that allowing for bill payments via different channels like EFT, Zapper, SnapScan, Masterpass and CHIPS®.

# Overview

## Bill Payment Token

Bill payment can be initiated based on a CHIPS® token.

![Bill Payment Token](https://marketplace.trustlinkhosting.com/images/Providers/CHIPS/BillPaymentToken-SequenceDiagram.png)
1. Exchanges between the App and the 3rd party backend server is done to get the correct billing details, account number and amount ready for the token request.
2. Once all the details have been finalize the App initiats the token request to the 3rd party backend. 
3. The 3rd party integrator calls the [*POST /chips/bills/payments/tokens*][post-chips-bills-payments-tokens] on the Trustlink API Marketplace.
4. The bill payment request is registered with the bill payments provider.
5. A payment token in registered with Masterpass
6. The token and fees per payment method is returned to the 3rd party backend.
7. The backend returns the token as the response to the request in step 2. The app should now prompt the user for the method of payment and confirm the fees that are to be paid.

## Credit card payment

The app can allow the user to pay with their credit card in several ways.
* The token can be entered into a Masterpass enables applications like CHIPS Money Manager [[Android]](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.chips.ewallet&gl=ZA) [[iOS]](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/chips-ewallet/id1402727891?ls=1), Masterpass banking apps, Zapper or SnapScan.
* The application can embed the Masterpass SDK.

![Bill Payment Card](https://marketplace.trustlinkhosting.com/images/Providers/CHIPS/BillPaymentCardPayment-SequenceDiagram.png)

1. The Masterpass enabled app or Masterpass SDK will send the token directly to Masterpass for payment.
2. Masterpass will notify the Trustlink API Gateway of the transaction result on a webhook.
3. The Trustlink API Gateway will forward the notification to the webhook as provided in step 3 on the token process.
4. The Masterpass app or SDK will be notified of the transaction result. 

> **Note**
>
> No API calls to the Trustlink API Gateway is required for this payment method.

## EFT payment 

For this payment method, the API Gateway will facilitate the transaction through an EFT payment provider.

![Bill Payment EFT](https://marketplace.trustlinkhosting.com/images/Providers/CHIPS/BillPaymentEFTPayment-SequenceDiagram.png)

1. The app will send the [*GET /chips/bills/payments/eft/{token}*][post-chips-bills-payments-eft] to the Trustlink API Gateway.
2. The payment request is registered with the EFT provider, which results in a URL being return. 
3. The API Gateway responds to step 1 with a 307 redirect.
4. The application is redirected to a web frame hosted on the EFT provider system.
5. The payment web frame is returned.
6. The user interacts with the webframe to complete the EFT.
7. The EFT Provider will notify the Trustlink API Gateway of the transaction result on a webhook.
8. The Trustlink API Gateway will forward the notification to the webhook as provided in step 3 on the token process.
9. The app is also notified of the transaction status

For more info on CHIPS® see:
* [CHIPS home page](https://chips.co.za)

# Getting Started
* Register on the [Trustlink API Marketplace](https://marketplace.trustlinkhosting.com/component/apiportal/registration)
* Send an email requesting access to the CHIPS Money API to apisales@trustlink.co.za

# Terms and Conditions
By using these APIs you agree to the following terms and conditions
1. [CHIPS Terms and Conditions](http://www.chips.co.za/downloads/CHIPS_Terms_Conditions_2019-07-25.pdf)
1. [AOS Terms and Conditions](http://www.chips.co.za/downloads/AOS_Terms_and_Conditions_2018-06-26.pdf)
1. Trustlink API Marketplace Usage and Authorization Terms and Conditions

fees.description: Fees applicable when paying via *card* or *eft*

apimStatus.title: Status
apimStatus.description:
All responses from the marketplace will at least contain the *apimStatus* object.  The purpose is to inform the requester of status details above and beyond the HTTP status code.

Note that it is possible to have a success indicator on the marketplace layer, but have a unsuccessful indication on the *providerCode*. This in essence means that even if the API to the provider returned for example a 'not found' result, the request is still chargable on the marketplace layer.

The *providerCode* will only be present if the API was routed to the API Provider.

## Marketplace Codes

| Code | Description |
|------|---------------|
| 200 | Successfully serviced and charged. |
| 250 | Successfully serviced with no charge. |
| 401 | Unauthorized.  |
| 404 | Not Found. |
| 450 | Application Not Found. |
| 451 | Organization Not Found. |
| 500 | Internal Server Error. |

marketplaceCode.description: Indicates status on the marketplace layer.
marketplaceCode.title: Markerplace layer status code

marketplaceMsg.title: Human readable message to provide more details on the *marketplaceCode*.
marketplaceMsg.example: An API subscription application for the requested URI was not found.
marketplaceMsg.description: Human readable description providing details about the error. On success the value will be 'Success'

providerCode.description: Error code returned API provider. The value is of type string seeing as the prodiver might respond with a string error code like 'ERRDB01'

statusCode.description: Same as the http status code

marketplaceId.description: Marketplace request id for support and tracing queries.

marketplaceMocked.description:
Indicates if the response was generated by a marketplace mockup. This is only relevant to API that start with the /storefront and /sandbox paths. 
If true, the API was not passed on to the API provider backend, but the response is being mocked up the marketplace.
If false, it indicates that the API call was pushed through to the API provider backend. The backend in turn might have stubbed the response in order to prevent costs like SMS notifications.

post.description: Billing information is registered and validated. A token is return which is Masterpass compatible and can be paid via CHIPS® Bill Payments EFT.

schema.title: CHIPS Bill Payment Token Request
schema.description: Payload to initiate a bill payment via a CHIPS® token.

get.description: Bill payment process is launched by redirecting the HTML response page.
